Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intracavitary Cisplatin-Fibrin and Hemithoracic Irradiation in a Rat Model of Pleural Mesothelioma

Trial_Design.evidence: Male Fischer 344 rats were randomized into five groups

Intervention.evidence: cis-fib+20 Gy IR group were significantly smaller than those in the IR alone group

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the safety and efficacy of combining intracavitary cisplatin-fibrin (cis-fib) with hemithoracic irradiation (IR)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was tumor growth delay, measured by bioluminescent imaging.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was conducted using a computer-generated sequence

Number_Randomised.evidence: Male Fischer 344 rats were randomized into five groups: cis-fib (n=9), 10 Gy IR (n=6), 20 Gy IR (n=9), cis-fib+10 Gy IR (n=6), and cis-fib+20 Gy IR (n=9)

Result_Outcome.evidence: At day 15, tumors in the cis-fib+20 Gy IR group were significantly smaller than those in the IR alone group (mean tumor growth, 252% vs 539%; P=0.04)

Harms.evidence: Short-term side effects were observed with 20 Gy IR, including transient weight loss and decreased lymphocyte count.
